MUS101.name: Freshman Seminar: Practical Foundations for Success in Music
MUS101.description: Introduction to skills necessary for academic success in music, careers in music, entrepreneurship, and professionalism in music.
MUS101.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Music.

MUS112.name: Chamber Music
MUS112.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS112.description: Rehearsal and performance of a broad range of chamber music literature.
MUS112.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS114.name: Marching Band
MUS114.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of marching band literature at football games.

MUS115.name: Spartan Brass
MUS115.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of brass literature at basketball and hockey games.

MUS116.name: Campus Band
MUS116.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS116.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of band literature chosen from baroque period to the present.

MUS117.name: Concert Band
MUS117.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS117.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of wind literature from various historical periods and styles.

MUS118.name: Wind Symphony
MUS118.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS118.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of wind literature from various periods and styles.

MUS119.name: Symphony Band
MUS119.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS119.description: Rehearsal and performance of a broad range of wind and percussion literature.

MUS120.name: Symphony Orchestra
MUS120.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS120.description: Rehearsal and performance of symphonic and operatic repertoire.

MUS122.name: Concert Orchestra
MUS122.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS122.description: Rehearsal and performance of symphonic and concert literature written for large orchestra. Conducted by staff conductors under the supervision of faculty.

MUS123.name: Campus Choir
MUS123.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS123.description: Rehearsal and performance of representative literature for mixed choir with emphasis on world music.

MUS124.name: Choral Union
MUS124.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS124.description: University and community chorus. One evening rehearsal per week, culminating in performance of a major work with orchestra.

MUS125.name: Glee Club, Men and Women
MUS125.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS125.description: Rehearsal and performance of broad range of choral literature chosen from medieval period to the present.

MUS126.name: State Singers
MUS126.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS126.description: Mixed choir performing music from all periods.

MUS127.name: University Chorale
MUS127.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS127.description: Mixed chamber choir for experienced singers performing representative literature from all periods.

MUS129.name: Percussion Ensemble
MUS129.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS129.description: Rehearsal and performance of representative works for percussion and mallet ensembles.

MUS130.name: Jazz Orchestra
MUS130.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS130.description: Rehearsal and performance in large jazz ensemble. The ensemble performs literature from classic bands of Ellington and Basie to contemporary composers.

MUS131.name: Jazz Combo
MUS131.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS131.description: Rehearsal and performance in small jazz ensembles. The ensemble performs literature from all historical periods of jazz.

MUS141.name: Class Instruction in Piano I
MUS141.description: Use of the piano as a teaching tool.
MUS141.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS142.name: Class Instruction in Piano II
MUS142.description: Use of the piano as a teaching tool.
MUS142.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS143.name: English Diction for Singers
MUS143.description: English lyric diction. Rules of pronunciation. Performance of English language songs in class.
MUS143.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS144.name: Italian Diction for Singers
MUS144.description: Italian lyric diction. Rules of pronunciation. Performance of Italian language songs in class.
MUS144.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS145.name: Class Instruction in Voice I
MUS145.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

MUS147.name: Class Instruction in Elementary Piano I
MUS147.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS147.description: Basic notation, performance, improvisation, and transposition. Repertoire includes folksongs, simple classics, and blues.
MUS147.restrictions: Not open to students in the College of Music.

MUS149.name: Keyboard Skills
MUS149.description: Sight-reading, transposing, figured bass, keyboard harmony.
MUS149.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS150A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS150A.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS154J.description: Private instruction in a brass instrument.
MUS154J.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS154N.name: Brass for Non-Music Majors
MUS154N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS154N.description: Private brass lessons for non-music majors.

MUS155.name: Percussion Instruments
MUS155.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS155.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS155J.name: Percussion Instruments: Jazz
MUS155J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS155J.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS155N.name: Percussion for Non-Music Majors
MUS155N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS155N.description: Private percussion lessons for non-music majors.

MUS160.name: Class Instruction in Guitar
MUS160.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS160.description: Chording, strumming, and finger picking techniques. Accompanying and song leading with guitar. Reading of notation and tablature. Classical and popular styles.
MUS160.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS162.name: Class Instruction in Flute and Saxophone
MUS162.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS162.description: Techniques for playing and teaching flute and saxophone.
MUS162.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS163.name: Class Instruction in Clarinet
MUS163.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS163.description: Techniques for playing and teaching clarinet.
MUS163.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS164.name: Class Instruction in Double Reed Instruments
MUS164.description: Techniques for playing and teaching oboe and bassoon.
MUS164.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS165.name: Class Instruction in High Brass Instruments
MUS165.description: Techniques for playing and teaching trumpet and horn.
MUS165.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS166.name: Class Instruction in Low Brass Instruments
MUS166.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS166.description: Techniques for playing and teaching trombone, euphonium, and tuba.
MUS166.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS171.name: Class Instruction in Stringed Instruments I
MUS171.description: Techniques for playing and teaching stringed instruments at the elementary level.
MUS171.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS172.name: Class Instruction in Stringed Instruments II
MUS172.description: Techniques for playing and teaching stringed instruments at the intermediate level and beyond.

MUS173.name: Class Instruction in Percussion Instruments I
MUS173.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS173.description: Techniques for playing and teaching percussion instruments at the elementary level.
MUS173.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS174.name: Class Instruction in Percussion Instruments II
MUS174.description: Techniques for playing and teaching percussion instruments at the intermediate level and beyond.

MUS175.name: Understanding Music
MUS175.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS175.description: An active and creative approach to understanding the elements of music in a wide variety of music styles. No prior musical skills required.

MUS177.name: Principles of Music Education I
MUS177.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS177.description: Historical foundations, current trends, and teaching responsibilities in music education at all curricular levels.

MUS178.name: Music Theory For Non Music Majors I
MUS178.description: Basic components of both written and aural music. No previous musical knowledge assumed.
MUS178.restrictions: Not open to students in the College of Music.

MUS180.name: Fundamentals of Music
MUS180.description: Conceptual and notational presentation of the basic components of musical structure.
MUS180.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS180E.name: Fundamentals of Music Intensive
MUS180E.description: Conceptual and notational presentation of the basic components of musical structure.
MUS180E.restrictions: Open to freshmen in the College of Music. Approval of college.

MUS181.name: Musicianship I
MUS181.description: Hierarchical musical structure through species counterpoint and figured bass. Linear and vertical aspects of tonality.
MUS181.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS182.name: Ear Training and Sight Singing I
MUS182.description: Dictation, melody singing using solfege (movable do) syllables, intervals to octave, error detection, quarter note values in rhythm, part singing.
MUS182.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS183.name: Ear Training and Sight Singing II
MUS183.description: Dictation, singing melodies in major and minor keys. Simple modulation, chromatic alteration, error detection, rhythms, triads and components, part singing.
MUS183.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS185.name: Jazz Styles and Analysis I
MUS185.description: Introduction to jazz. Listening and appreciating jazz. The focus of the course is jazz styles, history and analysis.
MUS185.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS186.name: Jazz Styles and Analysis II
MUS186.description: Introduction to jazz. Listening and appreciating jazz. The focus of the course is jazz styles, history and analysis.
MUS186.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS200.name: Music Theory Review
MUS200.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
MUS200.description: Review of elements of music theory, with emphasis on voice-leading and harmonic analysis in diatonic and chromatic music.
MUS200.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS201.name: Aural Skills Review
MUS201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS201.description: Review of ear training in the areas of melody, harmony, and rhythm and sight singing using the solfege system. Computer-aided drill programs.
MUS201.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS210.name: Song Writing
MUS210.description: Develop and refine the ability to express oneself through songwriting.

MUS211.name: History of Western Music to 1750
MUS211.description: Music from ancient Greece through the Baroque. Literature and theory of plainsong, instrumental and vocal traditions, and vocal polyphony before 1750 in sociopolitical context.
MUS211.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and open to students in the College of Music.

MUS212.name: History of Western Music Since 1750
MUS212.description: Literature of the cultivated tradition and its theory in sociopolitical context.
MUS212.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and open to students in the College of Music.

MUS230.name: Beginning Jazz Improvisation I
MUS230.description: Keys, modes, chord progressions as improvisational tools. Blues form in basic keys. The student will gain skills transcribing recorded solos.
MUS230.restrictions: Open to students in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS231.name: Beginning Jazz Improvisation II
MUS231.description: Performance of complete tunes. Transcriptions of recorded jazz solos.
MUS231.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS248.name: German Diction for Singers
MUS248.description: German lyric diction. Rules of pronunciation. Performance of German art songs in class.
MUS248.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS249.name: French Diction for Singers
MUS249.description: French lyric diction. Rules of pronunciation. Performance of French art songs in class.
MUS249.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS277.name: Principles of Music Education II
MUS277.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS277.description: Techniques for developing instructional and management skills for teaching music. On- and off-campus clinical experiences required.

MUS280.name: Musicianship II
MUS280.description: Techniques of diatonic modulation and soprano harmonization. Chromatic techniques.

MUS281.name: Musicianship III
MUS281.description: Research base for formal categorization. Large-scale principles of musical organization. Chromatic substitution and chords derived from voice-leading.

MUS282.name: Advanced Ear Training and Sight Singing I
MUS282.description: Dictation including recognition of triads, functions, cadences, seventh-chord harmonies, chord components. Two-and four-part dictation and singing.

MUS283.name: Advanced Ear Training and Sight Singing II
MUS283.description: Recognition of harmonic functions in major keys, minor keys, and modulations. Dictation in two-and four-part textures including augmented-sixth chords and nonharmonic tones.

MUS284.name: Composition Workshop
MUS284.description: Exploration of elements of music through the creative lens of music composition. Examine significant parameters of music by means of a variety of repertoire, both new and old, and through the study and demonstration of compositional techniques, approaches, and perspectives.
MUS284.restrictions: Open to freshmen in the Composition major or approval of college.

MUS286.name: Applied Music Composition I
MUS286.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS286.description: Private instruction in music composition. First level of one-on-one instruction in music composition tailored to each student's individual creative personality, strengths and needs.
MUS286.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores in the Composition major.

MUS287.name: Introduction to Electronic and Computer Music
MUS287.description: Project-based introduction to music composition using a Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) for processing and mixing audio files and synthesizing sounds. Topics include the science of sound, recording techniques, the history of electroacoustic music, and critical listening skills.
MUS287.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores in the Composition major or approval of college.

MUS290.name: Independent Study
MUS290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

MUS291.name: Selected Topics in Music
MUS291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS291.description: Topics selected and developed to enrich the music students educational experience beyond existing courses.

MUS301.name: Advanced Jazz Musicianship I
MUS301.description: Secondary dominants, borrowed chords, and tritone substitutions. Transcriptions of recorded jazz solos. Jazz piano skills.

MUS302.name: Advanced Jazz Musicianship II
MUS302.description: Pentatonic scale relationships within II-V-I progressions, Aleatoric approaches to improvisation, non-traditional chord progressions, and transcription of recorded jazz solos.

MUS303.name: Advanced Jazz Musicianship III
MUS303.description: Continuation of Advanced Jazz Musicianship II.
MUS303.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS304.name: Advanced Jazz Musicianship IV
MUS304.description: Continuation of Advanced Jazz Musicianship III.
MUS304.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Jazz Studies Major.

MUS335.name: Ensemble Conducting I
MUS335.description: Introduction to conducting and rehearsal techniques.
MUS335.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major and open to undergraduate students in the Composition major.

MUS336A.name: Ensemble Conducting II: Instrumental
MUS336A.description: Advanced conducting and rehearsal techniques as applied to music literature from each of the stylistic periods.
MUS336A.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS336B.name: Ensemble Conducting II: Choral
MUS336B.description: Advanced conducting and rehearsal techniques as applied to music literature from each of the stylistic periods.
MUS336B.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Education Major.

MUS337.name: Conducting for Music Performance Majors
MUS337.description: Beat patterns, clefs, and transpositions of string, wind, and percussion instruments. Score reading and analysis. Rehearsal techniques.
MUS337.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Music Performance Major and open to undergraduate students in the Composition major.

MUS340.name: Methods and Literature for Voice
MUS340.description: Methods of teaching voice. Literature for both private lessons and classrooms.
MUS340.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS341.name: String Pedagogy
MUS341.description: Principles, techniques, and materials for teaching stringed instruments.
MUS341.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS346.name: Keyboard Methods and Literature I
MUS346.description: Beginning and intermediate methods and literature for teaching piano. Observation and teaching of beginning piano students.
MUS346.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS347.name: Keyboard Methods and Literature II
MUS347.description: Intermediate and advanced methods and literature for teaching piano. Observation and teaching of piano students.
MUS347.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS348.name: Piano Accompanying
MUS348.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS348.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and open to students in the College of Music.

MUS349.name: Piano Performance
MUS349.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS349.description: Critique and analysis of individual performances in a group setting.
MUS349.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS350A.name: Piano
MUS350A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS350A.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS350C.name: Harp
MUS350C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS350C.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS350J.name: Applied Jazz Piano
MUS350J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS350J.description: Continuation of MUS 150J. Further refinement of listening skills. Technical analysis of more advanced forms of jazz styles and improvisation. Advanced techniques pertaining to the use of piano in contemporary settings.

MUS351.name: Voice
MUS351.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS351.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352A.name: Violin
MUS352A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352A.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352B.name: Viola
MUS352B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352B.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352C.name: Cello
MUS352C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352C.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352D.name: Double Bass
MUS352D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352D.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352E.name: Harp
MUS352E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352E.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS352J.name: Applied Jazz Strings
MUS352J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS352J.description: Continuation of MUS 152J. Further refinement of listening skills. Technical analysis of advanced forms of jazz styles and improvisation. Significant be-bop and hard-bop compositions. Advanced techniques pertaining to use of string instruments in contemporary settings.

MUS353A.name: Flute
MUS353A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353A.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS353B.name: Oboe
MUS353B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353B.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS353C.name: Clarinet
MUS353C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353C.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS353D.name: Saxophone
MUS353D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353D.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS353E.name: Bassoon
MUS353E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353E.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS353J.name: Applied Jazz Woodwinds
MUS353J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS353J.description: Continuation of MUS 153J. Further refinement of listening skills. Technical analysis of more advanced forms of jazz styles and improvisation. Significant, be-bop and hard-bop compositions. Advanced techniques pertaining to the use of woodwinds in contemporary settings.

MUS354A.name: Trumpet
MUS354A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354A.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS354B.name: Horn
MUS354B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354B.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS354C.name: Trombone
MUS354C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354C.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS354D.name: Euphonium
MUS354D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354D.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS354E.name: Tuba
MUS354E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354E.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS354J.name: Applied Jazz Brass
MUS354J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS354J.description: Continuation of MUS 154J. Further refinement of listening skills. Technical analysis of more advanced forms of jazz styles and improvisation. Significant be-bop and hard-bop compositions. Advanced techniques pertaining to the use of jazz brass in contemporary settings.

MUS355.name: Percussion
MUS355.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS355.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS355J.name: Applied Jazz Percussion
MUS355J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS355J.description: Continuation of MUS 155J. Further refinement of listening skills. Technical analysis of more advanced forms of jazz styles and improvisation. Significant be-bop and hard bop compositions. Advanced techniques pertaining to the use of jazz percussion in contemporary settings.

MUS380.name: Musical Styles and Forms
MUS380.description: Form in pre-20th century Western music. Stylistic analysis of representative medieval, renaissance, baroque, and 18th and 19th century compositions.
MUS380.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS381.name: 20th Century Music Theory (W)
MUS381.description: Western art music and jazz. Stylistic and formal analysis of representative compositions and jazz improvisations. Post-tonal theory. Jazz nomenclature and harmonic practice.
MUS381.prerequisite: (MUS 281) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

MUS387.name: Real Time Performance
MUS387.description: Introduction to live performance of electronic music. Topics include sound synthesis in real time performance, interactive electronics with instruments, spatialization, algorithmic composition, electronic instrument and interface design, installation, video and audio-visual performance practices.
MUS387.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Composition major or approval of college.

MUS400.name: Jazz Arranging and Composition I
MUS400.description: Jazz instrumental writing focusing on voicing concepts for standard jazz chord progressions, melody, counter-melody, and standard forms. Beginning orchestration techniques emphasizing form.

MUS401.name: Jazz Arranging and Composition II
MUS401.description: Jazz instrumental writing focusing on orchestration and arranging concepts for large jazz ensembles.

MUS409.name: American Music
MUS409.description: Music in American life with an emphasis on historical, folk music, art music, sacred music, and popular genres.
MUS409.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS410.name: Jazz History
MUS410.description: Survey of jazz from its beginnings in African American aural traditions to the present.
MUS410.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS413.name: Keyboard Literature to Mid-19th Century
MUS413.description: Keyboard styles and works of representative composers such as Bach, Couperin, Mozart, Haydn, and Beethoven.
MUS413.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS414.name: Keyboard Literature since the Mid-19th Century
MUS414.description: Keyboard styles and works of representative composers such as Schumann, Chopin, Ives, and Prokofiev.
MUS414.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS415.name: Art Song Literature: German
MUS415.description: Standard art song repertoire with emphasis on German Lieder. Performance of art songs in class.
MUS415.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music and not open to freshmen or sophomores.

MUS416.name: Art Song Literature: French, Spanish, and Italian
MUS416.description: Standard art song repertoire with emphasis on French, Spanish, and Italian art songs. Performance of art songs in class.
MUS416.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music and not open to freshmen or sophomores.

MUS417.name: Art Song Literature: British and American
MUS417.description: Standard art song repertoire with emphasis on British and American art songs. Performance of art songs in class.
MUS417.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music.

MUS418.name: Opera and Oratorio Aria Repertoire
MUS418.description: Opera and oratorio arias of Handel, Rossini, Mozart, Puccini, Verdi, Gounod, Saint-Saens, Massenet, Menotti, and Previn.
MUS418.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music.

MUS419.name: Baroque Music
MUS419.description: Developments in musical forms and styles from 1600-1750.
MUS419.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS420.name: Music of the 18th Century
MUS420.description: Late baroque and early classical traditions
MUS420.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS421.name: Music of the 19th Century
MUS421.description: Late classical and romantic period traditions
MUS421.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS422.name: Music of the 20th Century
MUS422.description: Twentieth-century styles, genres, forms, theories, aesthetics, performance practices, instruments and masterworks in sociopolitical context. Aural and score analysis of representative works.
MUS422.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS423.name: History of Opera
MUS423.description: Musical, cultural, and social significance of opera since 1600.
MUS423.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS424.name: Music, Sexuality, and Gender
MUS424.description: Inclusion and exclusion of women from histories of music. Comparison of historical women music-makers with contemporary women music-makers.
MUS424.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS425.name: Music of South Asia and Its Diaspora
MUS425.description: Music associated with the cultures of South Asian India and Pakistan, and South Asian musical practices in its Diaspora.
MUS425.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS426.name: Music of Africa
MUS426.description: Music associated with the cultures of Africa.
MUS426.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS429.name: Music of East Asia
MUS429.description: Music associated with the cultures of East Asia.
MUS429.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS430.name: Music of the Caribbean
MUS430.description: Music with the cultures of the Caribbean.
MUS430.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS434.name: Orchestral Musicianship
MUS434.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS434.description: Performance of standard symphonic literature of 18th, 19th and 20th century music for string instruments. Preparation for orchestral auditions.
MUS434.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music and not open to freshmen in the College of Music.

MUS435.name: Opera Theatre
MUS435.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS435.description: Rehearsal and performance of complete operas and operatic excerpts.

MUS436.name: Popular Music of Black America
MUS436.description: Black popular music from 1945 to the present. Influence on American popular music. Rhythm and blues, soul, funk, disco, rap, and their derivative forms. Role of African-American performers, songwriters, and producers in the development of a multibillion-dollar music industry.
MUS436.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS438.name: Jazz Pedagogy I
MUS438.description: Teaching theory and methodologies for jazz education in secondary schools.
MUS438.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music.

MUS439.name: Jazz Pedagogy II
MUS439.description: Teaching theory and methodologies for jazz education in secondary schools.

MUS441.name: Advanced Fixed Media Composition
MUS441.description: Compose and present sound pieces for fixed media using a Digital Audio Workstation (DAW). Emphasis on using technology to create form, gesture, timbre, and performance considerations including spatialization and electronic music notation. History and analysis of relevant historical electroacoustic works.
MUS441.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS442.name: Advanced Techniques in Real Time Performance
MUS442.description: Experience in live performance of electronic music. Topics include advanced sound synthesis in real time performance, advanced interactive electronics with instruments, spatialization, algorithmic composition, electronic instrument and interface design, installation, video and audio-visual performance practices
MUS442.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Composition major or approval of college.

MUS443.name: Anthropology of Music
MUS443.description: Study of social theories developed in anthropology and ethnomusicology.
MUS443.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS448.name: Advanced Keyboard Methods and Literature I
MUS448.description: Advanced piano literature for private lessons and classrooms.
MUS448.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS449.name: Advanced Keyboard Methods and Literature II
MUS449.description: Continuation of advanced keyboard methods and literature.
MUS449.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS455.name: Teaching Instrumental Music
MUS455.description: Development of skills necessary for teaching elementary and secondary band. Role of the instrumental music educator, purpose of instrumental music in the schools. Clinical experiences in schools required.
MUS455.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS456.name: Teaching Stringed Instruments
MUS456.description: Development of skills and knowledge for teaching string and orchestra programs in schools. Pedagogy, musicianship, curriculum, materials and program administration. Clinical experiences in schools required.
MUS456.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS461.name: Marching Band Methods
MUS461.description: Administration of school marching bands. Technical and philosophical aspects.
MUS461.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS463.name: Methods and Materials of Elementary Music
MUS463.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS463.description: How children learn music from early childhood to grade three.
MUS463.restrictions: Not open to students in the College of Music.

MUS465.name: Music in Early Childhood
MUS465.description: Music learning activities and teaching strategies for children ages three to six.
MUS465.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS466.name: Internship in Music
MUS466.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS466.description: Supervised pre-professional field experience in the arts. Students will complete a full semester (14 week) internship at their organization of choice (typically arts based).
MUS466.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS467.name: Teaching General Music in the Elementary School
MUS467.description: Techniques for teaching general music to students in grades K-6. Curriculum, pedagogy, materials, and program administration. Clinical experience in schools required.
MUS467.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS468.name: Teaching Choral Music
MUS468.description: Techniques for developing choral music programs. Curriculum, pedagogy, materials, and program administration. Clinical experiences in schools required.
MUS468.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS469.name: Teaching Secondary Classroom Music
MUS469.description: Techniques for teaching general music and elective music classes in middle schools and high schools. Clinical experiences in schools required.
MUS469.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores and open to students in the Music Education Major.

MUS480.name: Counterpoint
MUS480.description: Creative and analytical work with two-and three-part counterpoint in the style of J.S. Bach.
MUS480.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS481.name: Acting for Singers
MUS481.description: Solo acting techniques for the operatic stage.
MUS481.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the College of Music.

MUS482.name: Opera Scene Study
MUS482.description: Group acting techniques for the operatic stage.
MUS482.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the College of Music.

MUS483.name: Composition
MUS483.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS483.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music and open to students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities or approval of college.

MUS484.name: Instrumentation and Basic Orchestration
MUS484.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS486.name: Applied Music Composition II
MUS486.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS486.description: Second level of one-on-one instruction in music composition tailored to each student's individual creative personality, strengths and needs.
MUS486.restrictions: Open to students in the Composition major.

MUS487.name: Music Preparation and Presentation
MUS487.description: Examine the process of taking a composition from notated form to performance and beyond. Topics include notation, engraving, part preparation, effective written and oral communication, articulating artistic intent, grant writing, (self-)publishing, and dissemination of work.
MUS487.restrictions: Open to students in the Composition major or approval of college.

MUS490.name: Independent Study
MUS490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

MUS491.name: Special Topics in Music
MUS491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty for group study.

MUS494.name: Musicians' Health and Wellness
MUS494.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of even years
MUS494.description: Healthy musical and lifestyle habits and choices.
MUS494.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Music and open to graduate students in the College of Music and not open to freshmen in the College of Music.

MUS495.name: Student Teaching in Music
MUS495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS495.description: Supervised music teaching experience in schools. On-campus seminar required.
MUS495.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Music in Music Education.

MUS496.name: Your Music Business
MUS496.description: Focus on developing business skills for those contemplating entering music as a business.
MUS496.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Music.

MUS800.name: Advanced Jazz Arranging and Composition
MUS800.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS800.description: Advanced jazz instrumental writing focusing on developing harmonic skills at the piano for arranging purposes and arranging for small and large ensembles and voices. Advanced orchestration techniques. Music notation and score/chart preparation.
MUS800.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music or in the Jazz Studies Major or approval of college.

MUS801.name: Advanced Jazz Improvisation I
MUS801.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Music.

MUS802.name: Advanced Jazz Improvisation II
MUS802.description: Development and refinement of advanced improvisational skills.
MUS802.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Music.

MUS810.name: Graduate Jazz History
MUS810.description: Study of the written and recorded history of jazz as a musical art form. Examination of the role of race, culture, and politics in the development and dissemination of jazz.
MUS810.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS830.name: Research Methods and Materials in Music
MUS830.description: Organization, presentation, and documentation of research. Encyclopedias, indices, databases, and other aids.
MUS830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS832.name: Seminar in Ethnomusicology
MUS832.description: Historical development of ethnomusicology. Theories and techniques of the discipline.

MUS833.name: Fieldwork in Ethnomusicology
MUS833.description: Fieldwork methods and experience. Theoretical issues. Research strategies and techniques.

MUS840.name: Chamber Music Literature with Piano
MUS840.description: A survey of chamber music literature with piano from the Baroque period to the present. Explores the role of the piano in chamber ensembles. Offers performance practice and historical/theoretical guidance.
MUS840.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS841.name: Seminar in Advanced Collaborative Piano Techniques
MUS841.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS841.description: Development of advanced collaborative piano techniques through the study of art song, operatic arias, instrumental works, and chamber music. Provide the necessary skills and training to meet the demands and challenges for piano accompanists.
MUS841.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS842.name: Vocal Coaching Techniques
MUS842.description: Development of knowledge and skills required for successful vocal coaching
MUS842.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS843.name: Seminar in Piano Pedagogy
MUS843.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS843.description: Advanced piano pedagogy methods and materials for teaching piano at all levels. Conceptualizing and implementing a practical teaching project. Topics will be offered in a four-semester rotation
MUS843.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS844.name: Secondary or Specialist Emphasis: Piano
MUS844.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS844.description: Instruction in piano for students whose principal instrument is not piano.
MUS844.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS845.name: Secondary or Specialist Emphasis: Voice
MUS845.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS845.description: Instruction in vocal techniques for students whose principal emphasis is not voice.
MUS845.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS846.name: Secondary or Specialist Emphasis: String
MUS846.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS846.description: Instruction in violin, viola, cello, or double bass.
MUS846.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS847.name: Secondary or Specialist Emphasis: Brass
MUS847.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS847.description: Instruction in trumpet, trombone, euphonium, or tuba.
MUS847.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS848.name: Secondary or Specialist Emphasis: Woodwind
MUS848.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS848.description: Instruction in flute, clarinet, oboe, bassoon, or saxophone.
MUS848.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS849.name: Piano Performance
MUS849.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS849.description: Critique and analysis of individual performances of piano literature in a group setting.
MUS849.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS850A.name: Piano
MUS850A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS850A.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Education or in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS850B.name: Collaborative Piano
MUS850B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS850B.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS850J.name: Jazz Piano
MUS850J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS850J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS851.name: Voice
MUS851.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS851.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS852A.name: Violin
MUS852A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS852A.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS852B.name: Viola
MUS852B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS852B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS852C.name: Cello
MUS852C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS852C.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS852D.name: Double Bass
MUS852D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS852D.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS852E.name: Harp
MUS852E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

MUS852J.name: Jazz Strings
MUS852J.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of every year
MUS852J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS853A.name: Flute
MUS853A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853A.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS853B.name: Oboe
MUS853B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS853C.name: Clarinet
MUS853C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853C.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS853D.name: Saxophone
MUS853D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853D.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS853E.name: Bassoon
MUS853E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853E.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS853J.name: Jazz Woodwinds
MUS853J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS853J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS854A.name: Trumpet
MUS854A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854A.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS854B.name: Horn
MUS854B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854B.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS854C.name: Trombone
MUS854C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854C.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS854D.name: Euphonium
MUS854D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854D.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS854E.name: Tuba
MUS854E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854E.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS854J.name: Jazz Brass
MUS854J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS854J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS855.name: Percussion
MUS855.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS855.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Music in Music Performance.

MUS855J.name: Jazz Percussion
MUS855J.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS855J.description: Private instruction in jazz percussion instruments.
MUS855J.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS856.name: Chamber Music
MUS856.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS856.description: Performance of chamber music under faculty direction.
MUS856.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS857.name: Seminar in Choral Literature
MUS857.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS857.description: Various topics from the history of choral music. Topics vary by semester but may focus on works of a particular style period or of a particular genre.
MUS857.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS858A.name: Seminar in Wind Conducting
MUS858A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS858A.description: Advanced wind conducting, including core repertoire examination and execution with emphasis on score analysis and preparation.
MUS858A.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Music in Music Conducting or in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS858B.name: Seminar in Orchestral Conducting
MUS858B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS858B.description: Advanced conducting techniques for the orchestral literature of all periods for string, chamber, and symphony orchestras.
MUS858B.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Music in Music Conducting or in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS858C.name: Seminar in Choral Conducting
MUS858C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS858C.description: Advanced conducting techniques for choral and instrumental music of all periods.
MUS858C.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Music in Music Conducting or in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS860.name: Philosophical Considerations in Music Education
MUS860.description: Philosophical views regarding the nature of music education leading to the development of a personal, professional philosophy of music education.

MUS861.name: Seminar in Psychology of Music Education
MUS861.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of odd years
MUS861.description: Psychological foundations of music teaching and learning. Psychological research on problems in music teaching.

MUS862.name: Seminar in Music Curriculum and Methodology
MUS862.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of odd years
MUS862.description: Historical, philosophical, and psychological foundations of music education curriculum and methodology. Curriculum development and implementation.

MUS863.name: Seminar in the Sociology of Music Education
MUS863.description: Examination of sociological theories and research on musical experience and music education. Topics include
MUS863.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS864.name: Research in Music Education
MUS864.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of even years
MUS864.description: Methods of research in music education. Conceptualization and implementation of a study. Systematic information retrieval. Proposal writing.

MUS865.name: Capstone in Music Career Development
MUS865.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS865.description: Demonstrate mastery of music career skills through creation of a professional project related in entrepreneurship or self-employment.
MUS865.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS866.name: Graduate Internship in Music
MUS866.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS866.description: Supervised pre-professional field experience. Full semester (14 week) internship at the organization of choice (typically arts based).
MUS866.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS867.name: Practical Keyboard Musicianship
MUS867.description: Transposition, melody harmonization, realization and reduction of open scores, basic improvisation, and playing from various kinds of shorthands. Skills that facilitate musicianship in the classroom.
MUS867.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS868.name: Topics in Music Analysis
MUS868.description: Methods of analysis pertinent to a specific set of musical repertoire.
MUS868.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS869.name: Tonal Counterpoint
MUS869.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS869.description: Creative and analytical work with two-and three-part counterpoint in the style of J.S. Bach.
MUS869.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS870.name: Advanced Modal Counterpoint
MUS870.description: Techniques of voice-leading through imitative counterpoint. Compositional exercises modeled after sacred vocal polyphony of the sixteenth century, principally Palestrina and Victoria.
MUS870.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS871.name: Advanced Tonal Counterpoint
MUS871.description: Compositional exercises modeled after instrumental polyphony of the eighteenth century, principally J.S. Bach. Influence of fugal technique in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.
MUS871.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS872.name: Tonal Forms
MUS872.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS872.description: Music from the period of common practice and its relationship to music composition. Interplay of melody, harmony, rhythm, and timbre in various structural units.
MUS872.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS873.name: Early 20th Century Techniques
MUS873.description: Melodic, harmonic, rhythmic, and textural devices employed in early twentieth century music.
MUS873.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS874.name: Schenkerian Analysis
MUS874.description: Thought, works, and influences of Heinrich Schenker. Techniques of linear analysis emphasizing the role of long-range voice-leading musical structure.
MUS874.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS875.name: Analysis of Musical Scores
MUS875.description: Analysis of choral, orchestral, and band music as a means of enhancing interpretation and performance.
MUS875.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS876.name: Keyboard Skills and Practical Musicianship
MUS876.description: Playing and transposition of cadences, prolongations, sequences, and other idiomatic progressions. Elementary figured-bass realization and melody harmonization. Score reading at the keyboard, including in C-clefs. Stylistic improvisation. Functional keyboard skills for usage in teaching, studying, performing, memorizing, composing, and improvising music.
MUS876.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music. Approval of college.

MUS877.name: Scoring for Orchestra and Band
MUS877.description: Theory and practice in scoring for orchestra and band.
MUS877.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS878.name: Advanced Scoring for Orchestra and Band
MUS878.description: Orchestra scoring from Bach to Boulez and band scoring from Sousa to Maslanka. Advanced scoring projects.
MUS878.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS879.name: Tonal Literature and Analysis
MUS879.description: Analytical approaches to representative works from the tonal literature.
MUS879.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS880.name: Composition
MUS880.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS880.description: Advanced guided projects in creative writing of music.
MUS880.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS881.name: Seminar in Composition
MUS881.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS881.description: Study of contemporary music, with emphasis on compositional procedures.
MUS881.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS883.name: Advanced Computer Music Projects (Interim Change)
MUS883.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS883.description: Techniques and principles of composition and research with computers. Use of computer hardware and software.
MUS883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music or in the Computer Science Major.

MUS885.name: Advanced Jazz Styles and Analysis I
MUS885.description: Development and refinement of effective jazz listening and analysis skills focusing on an understanding and recognition of the basic elements of jazz and the different styles in jazz.
MUS885.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS886.name: Advanced Jazz Styles and Analysis II
MUS886.description: Continued development and refinement of effective jazz listening and analysis skills. Understanding and recognizing the basic elements of jazz and the different styles in jazz.
MUS886.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS890.name: Independent Study
MUS890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS890.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

MUS891.name: Special Topics
MUS891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis for graduate students.

MUS892A.name: Seminar in Music History
MUS892A.description: Various areas of music history, such as major composers, development of genres, criticism, or cultural context.
MUS892A.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS893.name: Topics in Music Entrepreneurship
MUS893.description: Advanced topics related to entrepreneurship and professional development.
MUS893.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music or approval of college.

MUS894.name: Seminar in Musicians' Health and Wellness
MUS894.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of even years
MUS894.description: Critical reading of research and scholarly resources in the area of performing arts.
MUS894.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS896.name: Master's Recital Performance
MUS896.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS896.description: Directed experience in recital performance in partial fulfillment of Plan B master's degree requirements for master's students in performance.
MUS896.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Music Performance major.

MUS897.name: Concert Conducting
MUS897.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS897.description: Directed experience in concert conducting in partial fulfillment of Plan B master's degree requirements.
MUS897.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Music.

MUS898.name: Master's Research
MUS898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS898.description: Directed research in support of Plan B master's degree requirements.
MUS898.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Music.

MUS899.name: Master's Thesis Research
MUS899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS899.description: Directed research in partial fulfillment of Plan A master's degree requirements.
MUS899.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Music.

MUS935.name: Seminar in 18th Century Music
MUS935.description: Research on topics in eighteenth-century music.
MUS935.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS936.name: Seminar in 19th-Century Music
MUS936.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS937.name: Seminar in 20th-Century Music
MUS937.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS958A.name: Seminar in Wind Conducting
MUS958A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS958A.description: Advanced wind conducting. Core repertoire examination and execution. Score analysis and preparation.
MUS958A.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS958B.name: Seminar in Orchestral Conducting
MUS958B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS958B.description: Advanced conducting techniques for the orchestral literature of all periods for string, chamber, and symphony orchestras.
MUS958B.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS958C.name: Seminar in Choral Conducting
MUS958C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS958C.description: Advanced conducting techniques for choral and instrumental music of all periods.
MUS958C.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Doctor of Musical Arts in Music Conducting.

MUS960.name: Seminar in Measurement in Music Education
MUS960.description: Theory and practice of measuring musical behavior in terms of aptitude and achievement. Current trends in cognitive, affective, and psychomotor measurement in music.
MUS960.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS962.name: Advanced Studies in the Philosophy of Music Education
MUS962.description: Historic and contemporary views of the value and import of music and music education and their translation into practice.

MUS964.name: Seminar in College Music Teaching
MUS964.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of even years
MUS964.description: Preparation for careers in post-secondary education. Development of teaching skills. Assessment, curriculum development, classroom technology, and adult students as learners.
MUS964.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS965.name: Conducting Research in Music Education
MUS965.description: Music education research projects using a diverse array of methods, designs, and analytical techniques.
MUS965.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS966.name: Seminar in Qualitative Research in Music Education
MUS966.description: Techniques of qualitative research in educational settings. Design and analysis, with a critical review of selected current research studies in music education.
MUS966.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS970.name: Pedagogy of Theory I
MUS970.description: Organization, goals, and procedures for teaching music theory to undergraduates. Choice and sequencing of topics, pacing, supplementary materials, educational philosophies, and relevance to performance.
MUS970.prerequisite: MUS 872 or MUS 873 or MUS 875 or MUS 879
MUS970.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS971.name: Pedagogy of Theory II
MUS971.description: Organization, goals, and procedures for teaching second-year and advanced music theory. Includes form, technology, and counterpoint.
MUS971.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS972.name: Advanced Keyboard Skills
MUS972.description: Playing and transposition of chromatic, modal, and post-tonal idioms. Advanced figured-bass realization and melody harmonization. Realization and reduction of large-ensemble scores including transposing instruments. Improvisation in a variety of historical styles. Functional keyboard stills for specialized applications in teaching, demonstrating, and studying music.
MUS972.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS973.name: Readings in Music Theory
MUS973.description: Exploration of current research trends in music theory. Critical readings of published articles and books. Formulation of independent research projects culminating in a term paper similar in scope to a conference presentation or article.
MUS973.prerequisite: MUS 872 or MUS 873 or MUS 869 or MUS 875 or MUS 879 or approval of college
MUS973.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS976.name: Performance and Analysis
MUS976.description: Exploration of how analysis can inform a performer's interpretative decisions and expressive choices.
MUS976.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS977.name: Schenkerian Analysis II
MUS977.description: Continuation of MUS 874. Analysis of complete compositions or movements from multi-movement works. Compositions to be studied will include ternary-and sonata-form pieces. Repertoire of styles will range from Baroque to Romantic. Making voice-leading graphs to become more familiar with Schenker’s writings and the secondary literature.
MUS977.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS978.name: Late 20th- and 21st-Century Techniques
MUS978.description: Study of theories and analytical techniques for post-WWII music.
MUS978.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS979.name: Proseminar in Music Theory
MUS979.description: Survey of current research areas and publications in the music-theoretic discipline.
MUS979.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS980.name: Composition
MUS980.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS980.description: Advanced guided projects in creative writing of music.
MUS980.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Music.

MUS990.name: Doctoral Independent Study
MUS990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS990.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual doctoral candidate and a faculty member in areas supplementing the regular course offerings.

MUS991.name: Special Topics
MUS991.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS991.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis for doctoral students.

MUS992.name: Seminar in Musicology
MUS992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MUS992.description: Advanced study of the history and culture of music in Western and/or world traditions. Specific topics vary by semester.
MUS992.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS996.name: Doctoral Recital Performance
MUS996.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS996.description: Directed experience in recital performance in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Doctor of Musical Arts degree.
MUS996.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS997.name: Doctoral Concert Conducting
MUS997.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS997.description: Directed experience in concert conducting in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Doctor of Musical Arts degree.
MUS997.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS998.name: Doctoral Music Composition
MUS998.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS998.description: Directed experience in composition in partial fulfillment of requirements for the Doctor of Musical Arts degree.
MUS998.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.

MUS999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
MUS999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MUS999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Music.
